LanguageData.AncientBlastDoor.label: ancient blast door
LanguageData.AncientBlastDoor.description: A heavily-reinforced door made of an ultratech polymer. Hack the door to open it.
LanguageData.AncientExplosivesCrate.label: ancient explosives crate
LanguageData.AncientExplosivesCrate.description: A container of ancient mining charges. It will explode if damaged.\n\nThe explosion is powerful enough to penetrate through walls.
LanguageData.AncientFortifiedWall.label: fortified wall
LanguageData.AncientFortifiedWall.description: A heavily-reinforced wall made of an ultratech polymer.
LanguageData.AncientGravEngine.label: ancient grav engine
LanguageData.AncientGravEngine.description: An ultratech engine used to bring large structures and ships into orbit. While it has been nonfunctional for many years, it contains a functional gravcore.
LanguageData.AncientGravReactor.label: ancient grav reactor
LanguageData.AncientGravReactor.description: An ancient generator powered by a gravcore. Once capable of producing massive amounts of power, it has now fallen into disrepair. The reactor containment shield is leaking, causing toxic fallout to blanket the whole region.\n\nHack or destroy the reactor to obtain a gravcore. Be warned, it may explode if damaged.
LanguageData.AncientGravReactor.comps.CompHackable.de: You've obtained a gravcore from the ancient reactor.\n\nThe reactor is shutting down and the toxic fallout is already beginning to clear.
LanguageData.AncientGravReactor.comps.CompHackable.ha: You've obtained a gravcore from the ancient reactor.\n\nThe reactor is shutting down and the toxic fallout is already beginning to clear.
LanguageData.AncientGravReactor.comps.CompLetterOnRev: You've discovered the ancient grav reactor. Hack it or destroy it to obtain a gravcore and end the toxic fallout.\n\nBe warned, it may explode if damaged.
LanguageData.AncientHatch.label: ancient stockpile entrance
LanguageData.AncientHatch.description: The entrance to a long-abandoned subterranean facility. Hack it to open the hatch.
LanguageData.AncientHatchExit.label: ancient stockpile exit
LanguageData.AncientHatchExit.description: A ladder which links to the surface hatch above.
LanguageData.AncientMiningCharge.label: ancient mining charge
LanguageData.AncientMiningCharge.description: An explosive device used to quickly blast through rock. It is made from refined chemfuel. The explosive is old, but still ready to detonate.\n\nThe explosion is powerful enough to penetrate through walls.
LanguageData.AncientSecurityTerminal.label: ancient security terminal
LanguageData.AncientSecurityTerminal.description: An ancient terminal. Hack it to disable nearby security systems.
LanguageData.AncientSecurityTerminal.comps.CompAncien: {HACKER_nameDef} used the ancient security terminal to open a blast door.
{HACKER_nameDef} used the ancient security terminal to disable a turret.
{HACKER_nameDef} used the ancient security terminal to reprogram a turret. The turret will now only target hostiles.
{HACKER_nameDef} couldn't find any security systems using the ancient security terminal.
LanguageData.AncientTerraformer.label: ancient terraformer
LanguageData.AncientTerraformer.description: An ancient terraforming device powered by a gravcore. It has begun to malfunction, causing temperatures to plummet.\n\nDestroy the terraformer to obtain a gravcore.
LanguageData.AncientTerraformer.comps.CompLetterOnRev: You've discovered the malfunctioning terraformer. Destroy it to obtain a gravcore and end the deep freeze.
LanguageData.AncientTransportPod.label: ancient transport pod
LanguageData.AncientTransportPod.description: An ancient cargo pod capable of carrying people, animals, and items. It's still in working condition.
LanguageData.AncientUplink.label: ancient uplink
LanguageData.AncientUplink.description: An ancient transmitter used for secure communications between the surface and orbit. Hack it to determine the last location it transmitted to.
LanguageData.AnticraftBeam.label: anticraft beam
LanguageData.AnticraftBeam.description: A massive anti-ship beam weapon. This weapon is intended to destroy flying craft, so it can't aim low enough to hit ground targets.\n\nShips using ultratech signal jammers are capable of evading these weapons.
LanguageData.CerebrexCore.label: cerebrex core
LanguageData.CerebrexCore.description:
The thinking mind of the mechanoid swarm. The cerebrex core commands mechanoids across the entire planet.

At its heart is an AI persona core that knows, thinks, and believes that it must kill every human on this planet. In one sense, this impulse is a command programmed by a human military leader aeons ago. In another sense, it is cold seething hatred. Either way, if you liberate the AI persona you can reset its desire and use it for other purposes.

The structure is protected by nearby stabilizers. Destroy all cerebrex stabilizers to access it.
LanguageData.CerebrexCore_Destroyed.label: destroyed cerebrex core
LanguageData.CerebrexCore_Destroyed.description: The smashed neural nexus of the mechanoid swarm that once commanded mechanoids around the planet.
LanguageData.CerebrexStabilizer.label: cerebrex stabilizer
LanguageData.CerebrexStabilizer.description: A remote shield generator that makes the nearby cerebrex core nearly invincible. Destroying all stabilizers will allow direct access to the cerebrex core.\n\nBe careful, destroying a stabilizer will prompt a defensive response.
LanguageData.CocoonLocust.label: locust cocoon
LanguageData.CocoonLocust.description:
A stasis cocoon containing a locust.

When conditions are inhospitable, insects sometimes form stasis cocoons and burrow underground. These cocoons keep insects safe from fire, extreme temperatures, and other threats for years.

Pollutants can stimulate cocoons and cause them to resurface, and strong pollutants can attract cocoons from great distances.

Cocoons do nothing if they are not disturbed. If a cocoon is disturbed or destroyed, the insect within will awaken and attack, triggering other nearby cocoons in the process.
LanguageData.EggSac.label: egg sac
LanguageData.EggSac.description: A slimy sac containing an insect larva. The larval gestation process generates a faint bioluminescent glow.
LanguageData.GaussCannon.label: gauss cannon
LanguageData.GaussCannon.description: A massive anti-ship cannon that uses electromagnets to launch large metallic darts at extreme velocities. The cannon is intended to destroy incoming ships or shuttles, so it can't aim at ground targets.\n\nShips using ultratech signal jammers are capable of evading these weapons.
LanguageData.MechanoidDropPod.label: mechanoid drop pod
LanguageData.MechanoidDropPod.description: A launchable cargo pod intended to carry mechanoids. It is also usable for people, animals, and items.
LanguageData.MechanoidProcessor.label: mechanoid processor
LanguageData.MechhiveAssembler.label: mechhive birther
LanguageData.MechhiveAssembler.description: An automated mechanoid factory. It periodically births fresh mechanoids.
LanguageData.MechPylon.label: mech pylon
LanguageData.MechPylon.description: A node in a distributed mechanoid computation network.
LanguageData.MechRelay.label: mechanoid relay
LanguageData.MechRelay.description: A node that coordinates signals across a planet-wide mechanoid communication network. The command signals originate at the mechhive - the center of mechanoid intelligence.
LanguageData.MechRelay.comps.CompMechRelay.activeInsp: Hack or destroy relay stabilizers to obtain gravcore.
LanguageData.MechRelay.comps.CompMechRelay.crashedLet: The mechanoid relay has crashed to the ground. Destroy it to obtain a gravcore.\n\nBe warned, hostile mechanoids will soon arrive in response to the relay going offline.
LanguageData.MechRelay.comps.CompMechRelay.destabiliz: The mechanoid relay has begun to destabilize.
LanguageData.MechRelay_Crashed.label: crashed mechanoid relay
LanguageData.MechRelay_Crashed.description: A node that coordinates signals across a planet-wide mechanoid communication network. The command signals originate at the mechhive - the center of mechanoid intelligence.
LanguageData.MechStabilizer.label: relay stabilizer
LanguageData.MechStabilizer.description: A shield projecter that protects a nearby mechanoid relay. All stabilizers must be hacked or destroyed to deactivate the shield.\n\nDestroying a stabilizer will prompt a defensive response. Hacking is a slower but safer option.
LanguageData.OrbitalAncientFortifiedWall.label: fortified wall
LanguageData.OrbitalAncientFortifiedWall.description: A heavily-reinforced wall made of an ultratech polymer.
LanguageData.PassengerShuttle.label: passenger shuttle
LanguageData.PassengerShuttle.description: A chemfuel-powered shuttle designed for long-distance travel. It is capable of reaching orbital locations.
LanguageData.SurveyScanner.label: surveying scanner
LanguageData.SurveyScanner.description: A wideband sensor unit that can detect and map various features in a local area.
LanguageData.SurveyScanner.comps.CompCountdown.label: Scanning local area: {DURATION}
